description: Kite.ly is a technology suite that can be embedded in any mobile app or website, enabling brands & businesses to print and ship products anywhere in the world.

events.name: webhookEvent
events.description: This method is called every time a Kite webhook event occurs
steps: You can add a webhook link at the Dashboard Notifications(https://www.kite.ly/settings/notifications)

args.name: token
args.info: Token sent on each message

blocks.name: requestAssetUploadLinks
blocks.description: Make a request to the Kite servers to get a signed Amazon S3 URL to which you can upload the asset.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key received from Kite

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Api secret received from Kite

args.name: mimeTypes
args.info: Array of one or more mime types for the assets that you want to upload.

blocks.name: uploadAsset
blocks.description: Upload asset using previously generated link

args.name: signedAssetLink
args.info: signed_requests from requestAssetUploadLinks

args.name: asset
args.info: Asset file

args.name: mimeType
args.info: Mime type for the assets that you want to upload.

blocks.name: orderPrintProduct
blocks.description: Make an order for print products

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key received from Kite

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Api secret received from Kite

args.name: templateType
args.info: Template type to print. Detailed information available at https://www.kite.ly/docs/#ordering-print-products

args.name: assets
args.info: Array of one or more assets to print

args.name: recipientName
args.info: The name of the person intended to receive the order

args.name: customerPhone
args.info: Customer phone

args.name: customerEmail
args.info: Customer email

args.name: addressLine1
args.info: The first line of the address

args.name: addressLine2
args.info: The second line of the address

args.name: addressLine3
args.info: The third line of the address

args.name: addressLine4
args.info: The fourth line of the address

args.name: countyState
args.info: The state/county/province of the address

args.name: city
args.info: The city of the address

args.name: postCode
args.info: The postcode of the address

args.name: countryCode
args.info: The countrycode of the address

args.name: amount
args.info: Accurate representation on the profit made on the sale within the orders section of the Kite dashboard.

args.name: currency
args.info: Currency code

blocks.name: listOrders
blocks.description: List all orders

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key received from Kite

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Api secret received from Kite

args.name: orderBy
args.info: Controls the ordering of the returned orders, valid options are time_submitted & status. A - can be added to the front of any option i.e. -time_submitted to reverse the ordering.

args.name: testOrder
args.info: If true then the results will be be filtered to only include test orders, if false then only live orders will be returned

args.name: errorExclude
args.info: If true then results will be filtered to only include successful orders, if false then only orders for which an error has occured will be returned

args.name: refundRequested
args.info: If true then results will be filtered to only include orders for which the customer has requested a refunded, if false then only orders for which there has been no refund request

args.name: timeSubmitted
args.info: GTE datetime. Orders will be filtered to only include those that were placed after this date & time

args.name: offset
args.info: The offset into the result set of objects returned

args.name: limit
args.info: By default, you get returned a paginated set of objects (20 per page is the default), by specifying the limit argument you can control the number of objects returned

blocks.name: getOrderStatus
blocks.description: Get status of single order

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key received from Kite

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Api secret received from Kite

args.name: orderId
args.info: Id of the order

blocks.name: listShippingMethods
blocks.description: List all shipping methods

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key received from Kite

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Api secret received from Kite

args.name: offset
args.info: The offset into the result set of objects returned

args.name: limit
args.info: By default, you get returned a paginated set of objects (20 per page is the default), by specifying the limit argument you can control the number of objects returned

blocks.name: getShippingMethodsByTemplate
blocks.description: List all shipping methods for the template

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key received from Kite

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Api secret received from Kite

args.name: template
args.info: Name of the template

args.name: offset
args.info: The offset into the result set of objects returned

args.name: limit
args.info: By default, you get returned a paginated set of objects (20 per page is the default), by specifying the limit argument you can control the number of objects returned

blocks.name: listCustomers
blocks.description: List all customers

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key received from Kite

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Api secret received from Kite

args.name: customer
args.info: If true then the resulting people list will be filtered to only include those who have placed an order, if false then the resulting list will only include people who have not placed an order

args.name: country
args.info: Array of 3 digit country codes i.e. GBR,USA that will filter the resulting person list to only include people coming from the specified countries

args.name: orderCountMore
args.info: Filters the resulting list to only include customers who have ordered more than the specified number of times

args.name: orderCountLess
args.info: Filters the resulting list to only include customers who have ordered less than the specified number of times

args.name: lastOrderedDateMore
args.info: Filters the resulting person list to only include people that have ordered more recently that the value. Valid values include Ndays, Nweeks, Nmonths where N is a number. E.g. 1days / 7weeks.

args.name: lastOrderedDateLess
args.info: Filters the resulting person list to only include people that have ordered less recently that the value. Valid values include Ndays, Nweeks, Nmonths where N is a number. E.g. 1days / 7weeks.

args.name: offset
args.info: The offset into the result set of objects returned

args.name: pushTokenIsset
args.info: If true filters the resulting list to only include people with push notification tokens, if false filters the resulting list to only include people without push notification tokens

args.name: livePerson
args.info: If true filters the resulting person list to only include people created in the live environment, if false filters the resulting person list to only include people created in the test environment

args.name: createdBefore
args.info: Filters the resulting list to only include those people created before the specified date time

args.name: limit
args.info: By default, you get returned a paginated set of objects (20 per page is the default), by specifying the limit argument you can control the number of objects returned

blocks.name: getCustomerDetails
blocks.description: Get detailed information about single customer

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key received from Kite

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Api secret received from Kite

args.name: customerId
args.info: Id of the customer

blocks.name: searchAddressBySearchTerm
blocks.description: You can perform a search on any part of the address not just the ZIP/Postal code and our smart sorting of results will order by nearest locations first. We also recognise common misspellings.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key received from Kite

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Api secret received from Kite

args.name: countryCode
args.info: Three letter country code to which the address search will be restricted

args.name: searchTerm
args.info: A free text value, often encompassing the first line of address or ZIP/Postal code, on which the search is performed.

blocks.name: searchAddressByAddressId
blocks.description: You can perform a search on any part of the address not just the ZIP/Postal code and our smart sorting of results will order by nearest locations first. We also recognise common misspellings.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key received from Kite

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Api secret received from Kite

args.name: countryCode
args.info: Three letter country code to which the address search will be restricted

args.name: addressId
args.info: A parameter referencing a previously returned address search results list item that can be used to lookup a unique address.
